name: AKS
description: "testing quoted decsiptions with , in them"

name: dbt-core
description: "dbt is a data transformation tool, primary for SQL, that brings best practices from software engineering to data development"

name: Metaplane
description: "Data observability tool with automated incident detection, impact analysis and root cause diagnosis for Snowflake, dbt and PowerBI. SaaS-service"

name: Git
description: Version control. Git is a system to track and manage changes to code.

name: Power BI
description: Data visualization tool that is the standard business intelligence tool in Storebrand

name: Hightouch
description: Reverse ETL-tool. A candidate to sync data from Snowflake to applications like Salesforce.

name: Github Actions
description: CI/CD-tool that allows automate our build, test and deployment pipelines

name: Python
description: Programming language that is used among other things for data analysis, task automation and data visualization.

name: dbt-expectations
description: Extension package for dbt that is inspired by Great Expectations. Greatly increases variety of tests you can perform on your data out of the box in dbt.

name: Qlik Replicate
description: "SaaS data replication tool that we use to replicate data from Oracle and MS SQL Server to Snowflake. Status: In use, but do not use for new projects."

name: Permifrost
description: A python tool for managing permissions in Snowflake.

name: SQL
description: Standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data from databases.

name: Terraform
description: "Infrastructure as code that we use to create, manage and improve infrastructure in Snowflake and dbt-cloud"

name: GitHub
description: Hosting service for software development and version control using Git

name: Meltano
description: Open-source, flexible and scalable tool to ingest tool to

name: Prefect
description: "Prefect is an orchestration tool written in Python that lets us define very flexible pipelines. Typical use cases includes kicking off dbt runs, load data from snowflake over to other systems, call APIs or other services, and trigger complex alerts."

name: Snowflake
description: Cloud Data Platform

name: dbt-cloud
description: dbt's SaaS-offering that enables us to easier deploy and orchestrate dbt-code

name: VSCode
description: Code editor

name: Hevo
description: "Click-based SaaS-tool to manage ingest to Snowflake from applications. Status: Tried, and currently not to be used."

name: Datadog
description: Datadog is a monitoring application for cloud applications that we use for tracking the overall state of our platform.

name: dbt Semantic Layer
description: "Define metrics alongside dbt models to guarantee the same answers everywhere, every time and from every tool"

name: LastPass
description: Password manager that we use for some non-critical secrets

name: Azure Key Vault (AKV)
description: Azure's key management solution.

name: WSL - Windows subsystem for linux
description: "Linux, running in windows. WSL allows developers on windows machines to develop using all the normal linux tools, while using windows just like anyone else. WSL is also Microsoft's recommended development environment for Python"

name: AVD - Azure Virtual Desktop
description: "Virtual machines running inside the Azure environment, providing a controlled environment, better security, and easier access to cloud resources"

name: Git Codespaces
description: "Enables development directly from github, on preconfigured pods"

name: GitPod
description: "Seamlessly develop in your preferred tool, using predefined containers for consistent environments"

name: Dagster
description: "Data orchestrator tool similar to Prefect. Status: Tried and evaluated, and currently not to be used as we went for Prefect instead. "

name: Azure Synapse
description: Microsoft Azure's competitor to Snowflake. Status: Aware, and won't be tested.

name: Snowsight for IDE
description: Snowflake's new and improved web interface for building and running ad hoc queries.

name: Jira
description: Issue tracking tool in Storebrand

name: Anaconda
description: "Python packaging environment and tools suite providing better security, especially for data scientists and business analysts using python."

name: Lightdash
description: Lightdash is a BI tool that turns your dbt-project into a full-stack BI platform

name: Snowsight for dashboards
description: Snowflake's new and improved web interface has rudimentary support for dashboards that can work for some use cases.

name: NeoVim
description: A VIM-based text editor that crazy people might prefer as their dbt ide.

name: Streamlit on Snowflake
description: "Host and run dashboards and apps running in python with the Streamlit framework - directly on snowflake, and integrated with SSO RBAC."

name: Airbyte
description: Airbyte automates the ingest (the E in ETL) to Snowflake through a wide range of connectors. Status: Tried, and currently not to be used.

name: Fivetran
description: Fivetran automates the ingest (the E in ETL) to Snowflake through a wide range of connectors. Status: Tried, and currently not to be used.

name: Azure Data Factory
description: Azure's cloud ETL service. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested.

name: Snyk
description: "Code security suite with plugins for IDEs like VSCode, providing live security audits and vulnerability scanning. Aimed at developers rather than data scientists and business analysts."

name: Patch.tech
description: "Enables fast APIs, both REST and GraphQL, using Snowflake as a source. Reverse ETL without batch-jobs."

name: Elementary
description: Open source data observability for dbt. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested.

name: Select Star
description: "Data catalog and lineage SaaS for the modern data stack."

name: Metaphor
description: "Data catalog and lineage SaaS for the modern data stack."

name: DataHub
description: "Data catalog and lineage tool for the modern data stack, provided both as Open Source and as SaaS. Status: We doubt we can properly secure an Open Source installation given the built-in security features, and inquiries about SaaS picing suggests they are prohibitively expensive."

name: Rivery
description: Extract/Load SaaS platform. Status: Trialed, feature set not a match for our needs.

name: Azure Purview
description: "Data governance solution with lineage, data discovery etc. Status: Prior experience, and currently not to be used."

name: Confluent
description: "Data streaming platform based on Apache Kafka. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested."

name: Grafana
description: "Open source analytics and visualization tool. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested."

name: Shiny
description: "Create visualizations, dashboards and apps using R and the Shiny library. One of the most feature-rich code-based tools for creating and sharing interactive visualizations. Status: Not trialed by the data platform team, R is not widely used in Storebrand."

name: SQL Fluff
description: SQL linter that works with Jinja and dbt. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested.

name: Monte Carlo
description: "Data observability tool, using machine learning to monitor Snowflake for data drift, missing data and other irregularities in the data. Status: We know little about pricing, and we are holding off while we trial Metaplane."

name: DeepChannel
description: "IDE for dbt-development. Status: Tried, and currently not to be used as it's a bit too alpha."""

name: Materialize
description: "Database for streaming. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested."

name: dbt-utils
description: A dbt-package that is maintained by dbtLabs that contains macros that can be (re)used across dbt projects.

name: Docker
description: "Enables microservices and virtualization for consistent environments."

name: re_data
description: "Open source tool, with a cloud-offering, to observe dbt data, set alerts and detect anomalies in our data"

name: Snowpark
description: "Framework for running Spark/Python directly in Snowflake."

name: R
description: "Programming language and packaging environment made for data analysis. Status: Limited adoption at Storebrand in general, few integrations with the rest of our toolset."

name: dbt-vault
description: dbt-package to automate the creation of dbt-models in the raw data layer in data vault. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested.

name: Kimball's dimensional modeling
description: With star schemas this is the most widely used and accepted form for modelling data warehouses

name: Data Products
description: "Treating data as products enables clean data handoffs and separation of concerns between teams. Data products can be combined with data contracts. The concept is part of the Data Mesh philosophy."

name: One big table
description: A modelling technique to serve one big table to consumers instead of a star schema with facts and dimensions.

name: Hub-spoke
description: A strategy with a central data team (us) and spokes (business units) as consumers/users of the platform.

name: Data contracts through dbt
description: With dbt 1.6 comes the possibility to declare contracts in dbt. This is a potentially important feature that allows us to modularize our dbt-repos.

name: Data Mesh
description: "Framework/Philosophy for modularizing data across different teams in the organization, enabling autonomous teams to exchange and use data from across the organization without a centralized data team."

name: Data vault
description: "Technique to highly automate the modelling of a data warehouse. Status: Aware, but yet to be tested"

name: Hashing of primary keys
description: "Technique to obfuscate data. Mostly used as primary keys instead of sequences. Status: Tried, and currently not to be used."
